We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Maitama, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	TheInternal Auditor is responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management, and governance processes across all business units within the Group.
	This role ensures compliance with policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements, identifies operational inefficiencies, and provides recommendations for continuous improvement.
	The position works closely with management to safeguard the organization&rsquo;s assets, enhance accountability, and maintain financial and operational integrity.


Responsibilities
Internal Audit Planning and Strategy:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive annual audit plan aligned with the organization&rsquo;s objectives.
	Identify high-risk areas and prioritize audits to address key operational and financial risks.
	Define the scope, objectives, and methodologies for individual audits.


Audit Execution and Reporting:


	Conduct financial, operational, and compliance audits to assess the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls.
	Evaluate the reliability and integrity of financial and operational information.
	Prepare detailed audit reports with findings, risks, and actionable recommendations for management.
	Present audit results to senior management and the board of directors in a clear and concise manner.


Compliance and Risk Management:


	Ensure compliance with internal policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
	Identify and assess potential risks, fraud, or irregularities in business operations.
	Recommend and monitor the implementation of risk mitigation strategies and control improvements.


Operational and Financial Reviews:


	Review business processes to identify inefficiencies, cost-saving opportunities, and areas for improvement.
	Monitor financial transactions, records, and reports to ensure accuracy and compliance.
	Conduct special audits and investigations as required by management or the board of directors.


Stakeholder Collaboration and Communication:


	Collaborate with external auditors, regulatory bodies, and other stakeholders to ensure transparency and alignment.
	Work closely with department heads to address audit findings and implement corrective actions.
	Provide guidance and training to employees on compliance and internal control matters.


Continuous Improvement and Innovation:


	Stay updated on industry trends, audit practices, and regulatory changes to enhance audit methodologies.
	Promote a culture of accountability, risk awareness, and continuous improvement throughout the organization.
	Leverage technology to improve audit processes, data analysis, and reporting efficiency.


Requirements
Education and Certifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Professional certifications such as CIA, CPA, ACCA, or CISA are highly desirable.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3- 6 years of experience in internal auditing, risk management, or financial compliance.
	Experience in a multi-business or diversified group structure is highly advantageous.


Skills:


	Analytical and Problem-Solving:
	Proficiency in data analysis, audit tools, and financial software.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills to support business integrity.


Communication and Reporting:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills for preparing reports and presentations.
	Ability to present audit findings clearly to senior management and the board.


Organizational and Execution:


	Strong ability to manage multiple tasks and deliver audits within tight deadlines.
	Detail-oriented with exceptional organizational skills.


Leadership and Interpersonal:


	Ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders across multiple business units.
	Strong interpersonal and leadership abilities to influence positive change.


Personal Attributes:


	High level of integrity, ethical standards, and professionalism.
	Adaptability to thrive in a dynamic and evolving business environment.
	Commitment to accountability, transparency, and continuous improvement.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letters to:&nbsp;recruitment@domeoresources.org&nbsp;using &quot; Internal Auditor &ndash; Abuja&quot; as the subject of the email.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Lab Technician

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment type: Full-time

 Responsibilities

	They are also responsible for creating and implementing care plans, documenting patient information, and educating patients and their families about health conditions and treatments.

Experience


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 1 year of work experience.


Salary
N50,000 - N100,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: zenithhospitalibadan@yahoo.com using tthe Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Hospital is in Ibadan, around Oluyole and Apata axis.
	candidate should be residing in a close area to this location.


 

 

2.) Nurse

	The hospital is at oluyole axis
	Candidates should be residing close to this location.


 

 

3.) Sonographer

Job Location: Oyo

	A sonographer's duties include operating ultrasound equipment to create images of internal organs, preparing and positioning patients for examinations, and reviewing images for quality and diagnostic content.
	They also analyze results, communicate findings to physicians, maintain patient records, and prepare preliminary reports.

  "description": "Greenland Hall is an excellent school, providing high-quality education both in the classroom and through a wide range of co-curricular activities. We have a history of high performance and put much of our success down to being an inclusive school at the heart of the community we serve.

We have high aspirations for all our students, and our goal is to improve the life chances of every learner, irrespective of their starting point. We believe that achievement leads to opportunity and choice, and this underpins all of our work in school.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Administrative Assistant

Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos and Ogun&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full Time

Position Overview


	The Administrative Assistant at Greenland Hall plays a vital role in supporting the school&rsquo;s daily operations by managing front-desk activities, maintaining accurate student and staff records, facilitating communication, and ensuring smooth administrative workflow across all departments.
	The role requires professionalism, discretion, strong organisational capacity, and the ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced academic environment.


Key Responsibilities
Front Desk and Reception:


	Serve as the first point of contact for parents, students, visitors, and vendors entering Greenland Hall.
	Manage incoming calls, emails, and general enquiries, ensuring they are professionally attended to and redirected appropriately.
	Enforce visitor protocols, maintain sign-in logs, and ensure adherence to the school&rsquo;s security procedures.


Student Administration:


	Maintain accurate student records and support the full admissions cycle, including enrolment, withdrawals, and transfers.
	Handle daily attendance tracking, follow-up on absences, and prepare attendance reports for school leadership.
	Assist in preparing student documents such as ID cards, certificates, and official letters.


Administrative and Staff Support:


	Coordinate schedules, appointments, and meetings for the Head of School, Administrators, and other leadership staff.
	Prepare meeting agendas, take minutes, and monitor progress on assigned action points.
	Provide administrative support to academic departments, including photocopying, scanning, printing, and document preparation.
	Monitor and replenish office stationery and supplies.


Communication and Correspondence:


	Draft, edit, and distribute official letters, memos, notices, and internal announcements on behalf of Greenland Hall management.
	Assist in managing school communication channels such as email broadcasts, WhatsApp groups, and notice boards.
	Maintain accurate communication logs and ensure timely circulation of important information.


Record Keeping and Documentation:


	Organise, update, and manage both digital and physical records for students, staff, and administrative files.
	Ensure confidentiality and compliance with school policies regarding sensitive information.
	Maintain administrative registers, forms, checklists, and operational logs.


Financial and Logistical Support:


	Provide support to the Accounts Office with fee-related inquiries where required.
	Receive deliveries, log received items, verify quantities, and hand over to the appropriate departments.
	Track job orders, maintenance requests, and follow up with the Facilities and Technical teams.


Event and Activity Coordination:


	Support the organisation of school events such as PTA meetings, assemblies, Open Days, and staff activities.
	Prepare logistics, materials, attendance sheets, and documents required for each event.
	Assist in coordinating internal meetings, staff training, and workshops.


Compliance and Safety:


	Ensure all visitors follow Greenland Hall&rsquo;s safety and security procedures.
	Assist with emergency drills, documentation of incidents, and compliance checks.
	Support the enforcement of safeguarding and operational procedures in line with school policy.


Office Management:


	Maintain a clean, organised, and professional administrative office environment.
	Ensure proper functioning of office equipment (printers, copiers, scanners) and report faults promptly.
	Support the implementation of efficient filing, workflow, and administrative systems.


Other Duties:


	Carry out any additional tasks assigned by the School Administrator, Head of School, or school management.
	Provide flexible support during peak periods such as admission season, examinations, and major school events.


Required Skills and Qualifications
Educational Requirements:


	Minimum of OND / HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management, Education, or a related field.
	Additional certifications in administrative management or ICT are an added advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace.
	Strong typing, document formatting, and data entry skills.
	Ability to manage digital filing systems and school management software (experience with SMS platforms or ERP systems is an advantage).


Professional Skills:


	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organisational and multitasking abilities.
	High level of discretion and ability to handle confidential information.
	Strong time management and ability to work under pressure.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.
	Customer service&ndash;oriented attitude, especially when interacting with parents and visitors.


Personal Attributes:


	Professional appearance and behaviour.
	Positive attitude, reliability, and a strong sense of responsibility.
	Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
	Flexibility and willingness to take on new tasks as required by the school.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Front Desk and Reception:


	Serve as the first point of contact for parents, students, visitors, and vendors entering Greenland Hall.
	Manage incoming calls, emails, and general enquiries, ensuring they are professionally attended to and redirected appropriately.
	Enforce visitor protocols, maintain sign-in logs, and ensure adherence to the school’s security procedures.


Student Administration:


	Maintain accurate student records and support the full admissions cycle, including enrolment, withdrawals, and transfers.
	Handle daily attendance tracking, follow-up on absences, and prepare attendance reports for school leadership.
	Assist in preparing student documents such as ID cards, certificates, and official letters.


Administrative and Staff Support:


	Coordinate schedules, appointments, and meetings for the Head of School, Administrators, and other leadership staff.
	Prepare meeting agendas, take minutes, and monitor progress on assigned action points.
	Provide administrative support to academic departments, including photocopying, scanning, printing, and document preparation.
	Monitor and replenish office stationery and supplies.


Communication and Correspondence:


	Draft, edit, and distribute official letters, memos, notices, and internal announcements on behalf of Greenland Hall management.
	Assist in managing school communication channels such as email broadcasts, WhatsApp groups, and notice boards.
	Maintain accurate communication logs and ensure timely circulation of important information.


Record Keeping and Documentation:


	Organise, update, and manage both digital and physical records for students, staff, and administrative files.
	Ensure confidentiality and compliance with school policies regarding sensitive information.
	Maintain administrative registers, forms, checklists, and operational logs.


Financial and Logistical Support:


	Provide support to the Accounts Office with fee-related inquiries where required.
	Receive deliveries, log received items, verify quantities, and hand over to the appropriate departments.
	Track job orders, maintenance requests, and follow up with the Facilities and Technical teams.


Event and Activity Coordination:


	Support the organisation of school events such as PTA meetings, assemblies, Open Days, and staff activities.
	Prepare logistics, materials, attendance sheets, and documents required for each event.
	Assist in coordinating internal meetings, staff training, and workshops.


Compliance and Safety:


	Ensure all visitors follow Greenland Hall’s safety and security procedures.
	Assist with emergency drills, documentation of incidents, and compliance checks.
	Support the enforcement of safeguarding and operational procedures in line with school policy.


Office Management:


	Maintain a clean, organised, and professional administrative office environment.
	Ensure proper functioning of office equipment (printers, copiers, scanners) and report faults promptly.
	Support the implementation of efficient filing, workflow, and administrative systems.


Other Duties:


	Carry out any additional tasks assigned by the School Administrator, Head of School, or school management.
	Provide flexible support during peak periods such as admission season, examinations, and major school events.


Required Skills and Qualifications
Educational Requirements:


	Minimum of OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management, Education, or a related field.
	Additional certifications in administrative management or ICT are an added advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Workspace.
	Strong typing, document formatting, and data entry skills.
	Ability to manage digital filing systems and school management software (experience with SMS platforms or ERP systems is an advantage).


Professional Skills:


	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organisational and multitasking abilities.
	High level of discretion and ability to handle confidential information.
	Strong time management and ability to work under pressure.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation.
	Customer service–oriented attitude, especially when interacting with parents and visitors.


Personal Attributes:


	Professional appearance and behaviour.
	Positive attitude, reliability, and a strong sense of responsibility.
	Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
	Flexibility and willingness to take on new tasks as required by the school.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@greenlandhall.orgusing the Job Position as subject of email.
